biogHist.p: Director, Actor, Playwright. Jane Heather completed her B.A. at the University of Alberta in 1975 and has performed, directed and written for both social action/community based theatre and conventional theatre. She has worked with a variety of communities including prison inmates, survivors of domestic violence, union women, aboriginal groups, and at risk youth on such issues as privatization, poverty, addictions and social change. Her works include "Are We There Yet?" a play for teens about sexual decision making and "Beloved Community" which contrasts ideological change through time by analyzing the relationship of an activist mother and her activist daughter on the eve of the G-8 conference in Kananaskis. In 1993, Ms. Heather received her M.F.A. (with distinction) from the University of Alberta. Additionally, Ms. Heather has also contributed to the development of theatre in Alberta through her work as a sessional instructor in the department of drama at the University of Alberta. At the U. of A., Ms. Heather has taught courses in or about: Improvisation, Directing, Collective Creation, Community-based Theatre, Feminist Theatre, Popular Theatre.
